message.content:
cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.IT, cs.SY, cs.GT 

The paper discusses the use of deep learning for designing heuristics for a problem in information theory and stochastic control theory. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.LG (Machine Learning) as it deals with the use of deep learning. The paper also involves the use of AI techniques for policy design, which makes cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) another likely sub-category. The problem being addressed involves hypothesis testing, which falls under the sub-category of cs.IT (Information Theory). The use of dynamic programming for characterizing optimal policies makes cs.SY (Systems and Control) another possible sub-category. Finally, the paper proposes a KL-divergence zero-sum game, which falls under the sub-category of cs.GT (Computer Science and Game Theory).
